formatted_address: 18 Marina Gardens Dr, Gardens by the Bay, Singapore 018953
name: Sun pavilion

reviews.text:
üèúÔ∏è Sun Pavilion is a tranquil sanctuary dedicated to the display of a collection of cactus and succulents.
üåµ Different species of pricky cactus and plum succulents from the world over are showcase here at the Sun Pavilion.
üåµThe gigantic cactus and huge succulents are a spectacular sight.
üåµ Sun Pavilion is located next to Water Lily Pond.

You can see the Marina Bay Sands from here. There are a lot of plants. The plants have labels which also has information about it. I took time reading some of it while waiting for the rain to stop. Good thing there is an available roofing for the plants and for people who visit here.

The brain is a good thing.
I really hope everyone has one.

How could you bear to destroy such a beautiful plant?

The section contains cactus plants, there are many species of cactus around here. If you like cactus, this is where you browse at. Some of the sections cactus are not fully protected and could cause injury to the pedistrian.

There is a pond here as well with swan statue, beautiful place.

Yah okeh this is way better than that battered excuse of a supertree  thing, which wasn't even a tree by the way. My expectations for the rest of the day was a bit low after that, but sun pavilion got it back up again.

To be honest, I'm not much into plants, but it's still very nice to see the different range of plants that can grow under the one roof. Sadly, there's no giant carnivorous plants to snap up the annoying children.

The pavilion is like a giant glasshouse. I couldn't get enough from looking at the structures though. It looks weird and alien-like from the outside, but it is absolutely stunning inside. I think the ticket prices were still overpriced for what it is, which made me contemplate my life a little. But I realised it was a waste of time because as stunning as it was, this was a once and done kind of thing.

vicinity: 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Gardens by the Bay
